title.narrative: Integrated WASH, and Protection support for people with high risk for COVID19 in northwest Syria

description.narrative:
The proposed action will provide an integrated multi sectoral Programme of lifesaving and life sustaining Water Sanitation and ‎Hygiene (WASH) ,and Protection assistance to acutely vulnerable Internally Displaced Persons ‎‎(IDPs) in Dana sub-district targeting 100% IDPs as 10, 758 beneficiaries (2,367 men, 2,475‎ women, 2,904‎ boys and 3,012 ‎girls) including 61 PWD in Idlib governorate, Kafr Deryan and Sarmada in Dana sub district. This is complementary ‎to an already running SCHF funded project in 15 camps in that area which will end in Nov 2020, and through this ‎project, SR will extend supporting 9 camps after Nov 2020 while the rest of 6 camps will be supported through ‎World vision . ‎This intervention will help us complete the activities that Syria Relief started in the same sites a year ago, by provide full WASH ‎service in same camps through WASH project funded by SCHF reserve allocation in Feb 2020, and thus it will make us avoid any ‎gap after SR ‘s project ended in 30 November 2020, Throughout SR WASH team, SR will benefit a total of 10,758 conflict affected people (100% IDPs) which will be as follows: Provide water through water trucking with 35 L/P/D, Collect waste and dislodge waste water- Clean bathing facilities– (SR will monitor the quality of the water through applying the Sphere and Syrian ‎standards). SR will conduct hygiene awareness sessions,‎‏ ‏with integration with Protection team through WASH and Protection ‎promoters, in addition, both CP and WASH teams will work together to provide COVID-19 awareness sessions to all mentioned ‎beneficiaries.
SR will Provide Protection services to displaced women and men, including those ‎living with disabilities, most affected by the COVID-19 pandemic and the conflict through targeting them with protection awareness ‎raising activities (GP, CP, RE, GBV) to 4500 beneficiaries (1500 women, 1500 men, 600 Girls and 600 Boys). In addition, SR will ‎provide case management services and individual protection assistance targeting 300 beneficiaries (75 men, 75 women, 75 boys ‎and 75 girls). ‎In collaboration with OCHA, SR will ensure the continuation of basic services, while also increasing access, both in terms of ‎quantity considering needs of PwD amp women and quality (meeting Sphere standards and cluster recommendations) of essential ‎WASH services. Increased focus will be placed on ensuring PwD have access to appropriate sanitation facilities, the Protection ‎concerns of women and girls are considered, and environmental health and hygiene promotion are enhanced. SR will stay in regular contact with the CCCM cluster to make them aware of any change or escalation in beneficiaries’ needs, and ‎will ask for their support if needed.. in case of newly displacements arrived to the targeted camps, SR will contact OCHA to ‎decrease the quantity water for each person 35 L/P/D, and also SR will contact with its HQ to cover the extra needs from its general ‎fund fund and will work with clusters and all partners , this project is part of SR plan in HPC, as the code ( HSYR20-WSH-164602-1)‎
